meanings.definition: A battle or conflict among gods.
meanings.sent1: The theomachy between Zeus and Poseidon shook the heavens.
meanings.sent2: Legends often tell stories of theomachy between powerful deities.
meanings.sent3: During the theomachy, even the mightiest gods trembled in fear.
meanings.sent4: The theomachy raged on, with thunderbolts clashing in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The theomachy was so intense that it caused earthquakes across the land.

meanings.definition: The act of fighting against or opposing gods.
meanings.sent1: The theomachy of the rebellious titan was doomed from the start.
meanings.sent2: Mortal heroes were warned never to engage in theomachy with divine beings.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous demigod found himself in theomachy with the entire pantheon.
meanings.sent4: The theomachy of the lone mortal against the gods was a futile endeavor.
meanings.sent5: The theomachy of the defiant sorcerer led to his ultimate downfall.
